result.execSummary:
The defendant Sohrob S. Damawand was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must appear at Probation today.  May be discharged from Probation early upon successful completion.

miscConds.notes: Eligible for expungment upon successful completion of Probation.  Must petition court.
Must undergo COMPAS evaluation and follow through with criminogenic needs as recommended by Probation.

CASES: 14CF102 & 14CF44. Defendant Sohrob S. Damawand in court with attorney John M O'Boyle.  Stephen C Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 2:50 pm.  On motion of state, Count 1 in each case are amended to violation of 943.24, issuance of worthless check.  14CF44-to amended count 1-guilty.  14CF102-to amended count 1-guilty.  CT-adj guilty, enter JOC.  
SENTENCE:  CT finds meets statutory requirements for expungement.  W/H sentence, probation up to 1 yr.  If early discharge required at 6 mo mark or after court will consider.  Waive court costs.  Restitution of $60.16 to Polk County Recycling.  No surcharge - pay through probation.  Compas & follow through w/ criminogenic needs.  To report to probation today.  3:10 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing on May 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Not to have contact with: Polk County Recycling Center.  Must appear at all future court appearances.  Defendant shall give written notice to the Clerk of this Court within 48 hours of any changes of address or telephone number.  Not to commit any new crimes.  Defendant shall neither directly or indirectly threaten, harass, intimidate or otherwise interfere with victims or witnesses in this action.

CASES: 14CF102 & 14CF44. Defendant Sohrob S. Damawand in court with attorney John M O'Boyle.  Stephen C Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 2:24 pm.  CT sets bond.  WSPH.  2:28 pm adj.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Initial appearance on April 28, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
